data.title: Jonathan Allen - Men's Basketball
data.meta_description: Jonathan Allen (23) G  - Jonathan Allen Career StatsÂ CAREER: A walk-on who saw his playing time steadily increase over his four seasons ... Appeared in 48 games
data.text:
Jonathan Allen Career StatsÂ

CAREER: A walk-on who saw his playing time steadily increase over his four seasons ... Appeared in 48 games and made nine starts ... Averaged 1.4 points and 1.5 rebounds in 11.0 minutes.

PEPPERDINE 2016-17: Played in 30 of the 31 games as a senior ... Started nine contests, including the final eight of the season ... Averaged 1.9 points and 1.9 rebounds in 13.3 minutes ... Played double-digit minutes the final 12 games of the season ... Scored a career-high 11 points at Santa Clara (2/16) after making five of six shots ... Also had 10 points at Montana (12/22), his first time scoring in double-figures ... Played a career-high 29 minutes in the WCC Tournament game vs. Pacific (3/3) ... Set another career high with seven rebounds at San Diego (2/11) ... Other season highs were two assists (three times), two steals (five times) and one blocked shot (three times).

PEPPERDINE 2015-16: Saw action in 16 games off the bench as a junior ... Scored 10 points and collected 17 rebounds (averages of 0.6 and 1.1, respectively) ... Scored his first career points vs. San Diego Christian (11/16) ... Made three-pointers at Gonzaga (12/21) and vs. San Diego (1/21) ... Pulled down a season-high three rebounds at Pacific (2/13) ... Also had season highs of 18 minutes and two steals at San Diego (1/28) ... Played double-digit minutes six times, including the WCC quarterfinal vs. San Francisco (3/5) and the CBI first-round game at Eastern Washington (3/16).

PEPPERDINE 2014-15: Sat out his sophomore season due to a knee injury.

PEPPERDINE 2013-14: Joined the squad as a walk-on ... Appeared in two games as a freshman ... Saw action in six minutes at BYU (1/9) and got one rebound and one steal ... Also played the final minute of the WCC quarterfinal game vs. Saint Mary's (3/8).

HIGH SCHOOL: Graduated from Ravenwood High School, located in Brentwood, Tenn., in 2013 ... Played three years of varsity basketball ... Averaged 13 points, five rebounds, three steals and two assists as a senior ... Earned Williamson County player of the week and student-athlete of the month honors ... A member of the National Honor Society and was on the honor roll.

CLUB: Played for TN Hoops, Nashville Celtics and TN Edge.

PERSONAL: Born in Orange County, Calif. ... Son of Lyndon and Sharyl Allen ... Has three siblings, Leighton, Sharrae and Jason ... Majoring in sport administration ... Chose to attend Pepperdine because "it's a great academic school and has an amazing campus. It has one of the top entertainment law programs in the country. Also, I always wanted to play college basketball so this school was a great fit for me."
